# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col, r'\s')

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    col = replace(col, r'[ -]', '_'))

    return col
end
```
This function takes a column name as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name according to the specified rules.
